sentences: Lapsed aitasid kodu puhastada ja tegid köögi puhtaks.
context: "Puhtaks" is the translative case form of the Estonian adjective "puhas" (clean/tidy/neat). The translative case in Estonian indicates a change of state or transformation - so "puhtaks" specifically means "into clean" or making something clean. It's used when describing an action that results in something becoming clean, such as cleaning a room (tegid ruumi puhtaks - made the room into clean).
